required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a 3D Printing Technology Learning Program
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a 3D Printing Technology Learning Program for Rehabilitation Professionals: a Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: 3D printing technology helps rehabilitation professionals make an order-made assistive device (AD). However, most have not learned how to use the technology for clinical practice. The study is aimed to evaluate a 3D printing technology learning program for rehabilitation professionals. Eligible participants who have a licence for physical, occupational or speech-language therapy and have not experienced learning any 3D printing technology. The learning program was conducted in accordance with Kolb's Experiential Learning Theory (Morris TH, 2020). The program was conducted over eight weeks. The outcome measure included the Japanese version of the modified Technology Acceptance Model questionnaire (TAM-J). It consists of 13 items and four scales; Perception of usefulness (28 points total), Perception of ease of use (35 points total), Attitude toward use (14 points total) and Intention to use (14 points total). Within-group analyses were performed using the Wilcoxon signed-rank test for the TAM-J between different time points.

primary_outcome.measure: The Japanese version of modified Technology Acceptance Model questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline a score of the Japanese version of modified Technology Acceptance Model questionnaire at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: A higher score means the strong acceptance of 3D printing technology(score range is 13 to 91 points)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Effects of a 3D Printing Technology Learning Program

intervention.description: The study is aimed to evaluate a 3D printing technology learning program for rehabilitation professionals
intervention.arm_group_label: Effects of a 3D Printing Technology Learning Program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible participants who have a licence for physical, occupational or speech-language therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have experienced learning any 3D printing technology.
